body.p: If a person has an atrial septal defect, they are likely to have __________.

multiple_choice.choice: blood flowing directly from their right atrium to their left atrium
blood flowing directly from their left atrium to their right atrium
blood flowing directly from their left ventricle to their right atrium
blood flowing directly from their pulmonary vein into their right atrium

response.feedback: Incorrect. Although the shunt pathway is between the atria, the higher pressure of the left atrium (under normal conditions) causes the blood to move from the left atrium to the right atrium.
Correct. The shunt pathway is between the two atria, with the higher pressure in the left atrium pushing blood into the right atrium.
Incorrect. In this condition, the shunt pathway is between the atria, not between an atrium and ventricle.

Incorrect. Although with this condition blood from the pulmonary vein may move into the right atrium instead of passing through the systemic circulation, the blood does not pass directly from the pulmonary vein into the right atrium.
